title: 日本淺草觀音寺一百籤第一籤
poem: 七寶浮圖塔,高峯頂上安,衆人皆仰望,莫作等閑看

analysis.zh: 詩中以「七寶浮圖塔」描繪出如同以七顆寶石裝飾的佛塔，象徵吉祥與美好。高峯頂上安寓意站在高處，視野廣闊，可獲得周圍人的信任與支持。眾人皆仰望則表示這份美好與吉祥會被眾人看見、敬仰。最後一句「莫作等閑看」提醒人們不應對這美好輕視，須以正確的態度面對，才能收穫更好的結果。
analysis.en: The poem paints a picture of a tower shimmering with seven treasures, symbolizing auspiciousness and beauty. The phrase "high peak top" conveys a lofty perspective, suggesting that standing tall and seeing broadly earns trust and support from those around you. "All people look up" indicates that this beauty and good fortune will be admired by many. Finally, "do not treat it as trivial" reminds the reader to approach this blessing with the proper attitude, so that more favorable outcomes will follow.
analysis.jp: 詩は、七つの宝が浮かぶ塔を描き、吉祥と美しさを象徴しています。「高峰頂上安」は高みから広い視野を得ることで周囲からの信頼と支持を得られることを示唆しています。「眾人皆仰望」は、多くの人々がその美しさと幸運を賞賛することを意味します。最後の「莫作等閑看」は、この恵みを軽視せず、正しい姿勢で臨むように促しており、そうすればより良い結果が得られるでしょう。

rag_analysis:
According to the poem, the core meaning is:
- The tower, adorned with seven treasures, represents auspiciousness and prosperity that rises above ordinary concerns.
- The image of the "high peak top" conveys a lofty viewpoint, suggesting that maintaining a broad perspective and standing tall earns the trust and support of those around you.
- The line "all people look up" indicates that this auspicious sight will be seen and admired by many, reinforcing its significance.
- The admonition "do not treat it as trivial" serves as a reminder to regard this blessing with seriousness and proper attention, ensuring that the favorable outcome is fully realized.
- Collectively, the poem encourages vigilance, respect for the good fortune that appears, and a mindful approach to life’s blessings.
